data.title: The Addams Family Musical Cast Lists
data.meta_description: The following are the cast lists for all five known past, present and future productions of The Addams Family: A New Musical in order of opening night debut. First Preview: November 13, 2009 Opening Night: December 9, 2009 Closing Night: January 10, 2010 Venue: Ford Center for the Performing...
data.text:
The following are the cast lists for all five known past, present and future productions of The Addams Family: A New Musical in order of opening night debut.

Chicago Tryout (Closed)[]

First Preview: November 13, 2009

Opening Night: December 9, 2009

Closing Night: January 10, 2010

Venue: Ford Center for the Performing Arts Oriental Theatre

Transferred to: Broadway

Original Chicago Tryout Cast[]

Principals (in order of appearance)

Nathan Lane as Gomez Addams

Bebe Neuwirth as Morticia Addams

Kevin Chamberlin as Uncle Fester

Jackie Hoffman as Grandmama

Krysta Rodriguez as Wednesday Addams

Adam Riegler as Pugsley Addams

Zachary James as Lurch

Terrence Mann as Mal Beineke

Carolee Carmello as Alice Beineke

Wesley Taylor as Lucas Beineke

The Addams Ancestors: Michael Buchanan, Rachel de Benedet, Matthew Gumley, Fred Inkley, Morgan James, Clark Johnsen, Barret Martin, Jessica Lea Patty, Liz Ramos, Charlie Sutton, Aléna Watters.

Standby: For Gomez Addams & Mal Beineke: Merwin Foard.

Understudies: Understudy for Gomez: Jim Borstelmann. For Morticia: Rachel de Benedet, Jessica Lea Patty. For Uncle Fester: Jim Borstelmann. For Mal Beineke: Fred Inkley. For Alice Beineke: Valerie Fagan, Morgan James. For Grandma: Valerie Fagan. For Wednesday: Morgan James, Jessica Lea Patty. For Lucas Beineke: Clark Johnsen. For Pugsley: Matthew Gumley. For Lurch: Fred Inkley, Barret Martin.

Swings: Jim Borstelmann, Valerie Fagan, Samantha Sturm. Dance Captain: Liz Ramos. Puppet Performance Captain/Asst. Dance Captain/Swing: Colin Cunliffe.

Broadway, New York[]

First Preview: March 8, 2010

Opening Night: April 8 2010

Closing Night: December 31, 2011

Venue: Lunt-Fontanne Theatre

Final Broadway Cast[]

Principals (in order of appearance)

Roger Rees as Gomez Addams

Brooke Shields as Morticia Addams

Brad Oscar as Uncle Fester

Jackie Hoffman as Grandma

Rachel Potter as Wednesday Addams

Adam Riegler as Pugsley Addams

Zachary James as Lurch

Adam Grupper as Mal Beineke

Heidi Blickenstaff as Alice Beineke

Jesse Swenson as Lucas Beineke

The Addams Ancestors: Becca Ayers, Tom Berklund, Mo Brady, Erick Buckley, Stephanie Gibson, Fred Inkley, Lisa Karlin, Reed Kelly, Allison Thomas Lee, Tess Soltau, Logan Rowland.

Standby: For Gomez Addams & Mal Beineke: Merwin Foard.

Understudies: Understudy for Gomez: Jim Borstelmann. For Morticia: Stephanie Gibson, Becca Ayers. For Uncle Fester: Jim Borstelmann, Erick Buckley. For Mal Beineke: Fred Inkley. For Alice Beineke & Grandma: Valerie Fagan, Becca Ayers. For Wednesday: Tess Soltau, Lisa Karlin. For Lucas Beineke: Mo Brady, Colin Cunliffe. For Pugsley: Logan Rowland. For Lurch: Fred Inkley, Tom Berklund.

Swings: Jim Borstelmann, Mike Cannon, Valerie Fagan. Puppet Performance Captain/Dance Captain/Swing: Colin Cunliffe. Asst. Dance Captain/Swing: Samantha Sturm.

Original Broadway Cast[]

Principals (in order of appearance)

Nathan Lane as Gomez Addams

Bebe Neuwirth as Morticia Addams

Kevin Chamberlin as Uncle Fester

Jackie Hoffman as Grandma

Krysta Rodriguez as Wednesday Addams

Adam Riegler as Pugsley Addams

Zachary James as Lurch

Terrence Mann as Mal Beineke

Carolee Carmello as Alice Beineke

Wesley Taylor as Lucas Beineke

The Addams Ancestors: Erick Buckley, Rachel de Benedet, Matthew Gumley, Fred Inkley, Morgan James, Clark Johnsen, Barret Martin, Jessica Lea Patty, Liz Ramos, Charlie Sutton, Aléna Watters.

Standbys: For Gomez Addams & Mal Beineke: Merwin Foard.

Understudies: Understudy for Gomez: Jim Borstelmann. For Morticia: Rachel de Benedet, Jessica Lea Patty. For Uncle Fester: Jim Borstelmann, Erick Buckley. For Mal Beineke: Fred Inkley. For Alice Beineke: Valerie Fagan, Morgan James. For Grandma: Valerie Fagan. For Wednesday: Morgan James, Jessica Lea Patty. For Lucas Beineke: Clark Johnsen, Colin Cunliffe. For Pugsley: Matthew Gumley. For Lurch: Fred Inkley, Barret Martin.

Swings: Jim Borstelmann, Valerie Fagan, Samantha Sturm. Dance Captain: Liz Ramos. Puppet Performance Captain/Asst. Dance Captain/Swing: Colin Cunliffe.

Broadway Cast Replacemant History[]

Note: only replacements of principal characters are noted

Merwin Foard replaced Nathan Lane as Gomez Addams on March 8, 2011.

Brad Oscar replaced Kevin Chamberlin as Uncle Fester on March 8, 2011.

Rachel Potter replaced Krysta Rodriguez as Wednesday Addams on March 8, 2011.

Adam Grupper replaced Terrence Mann as Mal Beineke on March 8, 2011.

Heidi Blickenstaff replaced Carolee Carmello as Alice Beineke on March 8, 2011.

Jesse Swenson replaced Wesley Taylor as Lucas Beineke on March 8, 2011.

Roger Rees replaced Merwin Foard as Gomez Addams on March 22, 2011.

Brooke Shields replaced Bebe Neuwirth as Morticia Addams on June 28, 2011.

Broadway Standby Replacemant History[]

Merwin Foard temporary left the role of standby for Gomez Addams and Mal Beineke from March 8 to March 22, 2011.

United States National Tour[]

Opening Night: September 15, 2011

First Venue: Mahalia Jackson Theater for the Performing Arts, New Orleans, LA

Current United States National Tour Cast[]

Principals (in order of appearance)

Douglas Sills as Gomez Addams

Sara Gettelfinger as Morticia Addams

Blake Hammond as Uncle Fester

Pippa Pearthree as Grandma

Cortney Wolfson as Wednesday Addams

Patrick D. Kennedy as Pugsley Addams

Zachary James as Lurch

Martin Vidnovic as Mal Beineke

Gaelen Gilliland as Alice Beineke

Curtis Holbrook as Lucas Beineke

The Addams Ancestors: Sara Andreas, Lauryn Ciardullo,Steve Geary, Victoria Huston-Elem, Megan Jimenez, Patrick Oliver Jones, Lizzie Klemperer, MIchelle Marmolejo, Christy Morton, Brad Nacht, Jonathan Ritter, Murray Rundus, Roland Rusinek, Matthew Schmidt, Geo Seery.

Understudies: Understudy for Gomez: Brad Nacht, Martin Vidnovic. For Morticia: Sara Andreas, Christy Morton. For Uncle Fester: Roland Rusinek, Brad Nacht. For Mal Beineke: Patrick Oliver Jones, Brad Nacht. For Alice Beineke and Grandma: Christy Morton, Victoria Huston-Elem. For Wednesday: Megan Jimenez, Lizzie Klemperer. For Lucas Beineke: Jonathan Ritter, Matthew Schmidt For Pugsley: Murray Rundus For Lurch: Geo Seery, Patrick Oliver Jones.

Swings: Victoria Huston-Elem, Brad Nacht. Dance Captain/Swing: Jonathan Ritter. Asst. Dance Captain: Michelle Marmalejo

Original United States National Tour Cast[]

Principals(in order of appearance)

Douglas Sills as Gomez Addams

Sara Gettelfinger as Morticia Addams

Blake Hammond as Uncle Fester

Pippa Pearthree as Grandma

Cortney Wolfson as Wednesday Addams

Patrick D. Kennedy as Pugsley Addams

Tom Corbeil as Lurch

Martin Vidnovic as Mal Beineke

Crista Moore as Alice Beineke

Brian Justin Crum as Lucas Beineke

The Addams Ancestors: Ted Ely, Karla Garcia, Steve Geary, Patrick Oliver Jones, Lizzie Klemperer, Christy Morton, Rebecca Riker, Roland Rusinek, Geo Seery, Samantha Shafer, Jason Eric Testa.

Understudies: Understudy for Gomez: Brad Nacht, Martin Vidnovic. For Morticia: Samantha Shafer, Rebecca Riker. For Uncle Fester: Roland Rusinek, Brad Nacht. For Mal Beineke: Patrick Oliver Jones, Brad Nacht. For Alice Beineke and Grandma: Christy Morton, Victoria Huston-Elem. For Wednesday: Alexandra Matteo, Lizzie Klemperer. For Lucas Beineke: Jonathan Ritter, Ted Ely. For Pugsley: Jason Eric Testa. For Lurch: Geo Seery, Patrick Oliver Jones.

Swings: Victoria Huston-Elem, Brad Nacht. Dance Captain/Swing: Jonathan Ritter. Asst. Dance Captain/Swing: Alexandra Matteo.

United States National Tour Cast Replacement History[]

Note: only replacements of principal characters are noted

Gaelen Gilliland replaced Crista Moore as Alice Beineke on May 1, 2012.

Ethan Wexler replaced Jason Eric Testa as u/s Pugsley Addams on March 12,2012

Pilar Millholen replaced Rebecca Riker as Ancestor (Dead Flapper) on March 12,2012

Christy Morton replaced Rebecca Riker as u/s Mortica Addams

Murray Rundus replaced Ethan Wexler as u/s Pugsley Addams

Sao Paulo, Brazil[]

First Preview: 2012

Opening Night: 2012

Venue:

Original Sao Paulo Cast[]

Principals (in order of appearance)

Daniel Boaventura as Gomez Addams

Marisa Orth as Morticia Addams

Claudio Galvan as Uncle Fester

Iná de Carvalho as Grandma

Laura Lobo as Wednesday Addams

Nicholas Torres, Gustavo Daneluz & Matheus Lustosa as Pugsley Addams

Rogério Guedes as Lurch

Wellington Nogueira as Mal Beineke

Paula Capovilla as Alice Beineke

Beto Sargentelli as Lucas Beineke

The Addams Ancestors:Fábio Barreto, Felipe Abrahão, Julia Duarte, Kauê Braga, Mariana Hidemi, Marisol Marcondes, Milena Lopes, Patrick Amstalden, Roberta Jafet, Will Anderson

Alternate: For Morticia Addams: Sara Sarres.

Sydney, Australia[]

First Preview: March 2013

Opening Night: March 2013

Cast[]

Chole Dallimore as Morticia Addams

John Waters as Gomez Addams

Teagan Wouters as Wednesday Addams

Daniel Simpson, Anthony Garcia, Blake Hurford and Jaxon Graham-Wilson as Pugsley Addams

Meredith O'Reilly as Grandma

Russel Dykstra as Uncle Fester

Ben Hudson as Lurch

The Beinekes[]

Tony Harvey as Mal Beineke

Katrina Retallick as Alice Beineke

Tim Maddren as Lucas Beineke

The Addams Ancestors: Jakob Ambrose, Andrew Broadbent, Emma Clark, Cristina D’Agostino, Matt Heyward, Kelly Hoskin, Zoë Komazec, Peter Lowrey, Jordan Pollard, Justine Puy, Warwick Reid, Samantha Riley, Lisa Sontag, Shane Stepien and Robert Tripolino.

California, United States of America[]

Opening Night: October 15, 2016

Closing Night: November 6, 2016

Venue: The Grove Theater of Upland, Ca

Cast - TBA[]
